IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: STRENGTHEN THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BY INCREASING THE INVESTMENT IN WOMEN AND GIRLS AND EMPOWERING WOMEN'S PHILANTHROPY - THROUGH GRANT- MAKING, GENDER-SPECIFIC RESEARCH AND PHILANTHROPY EDUCATION.
IRS990.MissionDescription: DALLAS WOMEN'S FOUNDATION STRENGTHENS THE ENTIRE COMMUNITY BY INCREASING THE INVESTMENT IN WOMEN AND GIRLS AND EMPOWERING WOMEN'S PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.Description: GRANTMAKING - During the year ended June 30, 2010, Dallas Women's Foundation awarded 162 grants to 108 agencies. Grants ranged in amount from $500 to $250,000. The majority of the grants were awarded to programs serving women and girls in the areas of: Education & Training, Economic Security, Family Violence Prevention & Intervention, and Health and Life Skills.

Activity2.Description: PHILANTHROPY EDUCATION - Approximately 400 individuals attended philanthropy education hosted by Dallas Women's Foundation during the year ended June 30, 2010. These events assist women and their families with aligning their philanthropic giving with their personal values and provide them with information about ways to manage their philanthropic assets.

Activity3.Description: RESEARCH - Two research reports were issued during the year ending June 30, 2010: 1) "Health & Safety Indicators", which included statistical measures of health & safety of women in the 12 counties in the Dallas Fort Worth region and 2) "Gender Matters: An Analysis of the Texas State Budget", which used a gender lens to analyze the impact of fiscal policy on the health, safety, education & economic security of Texas' women & girls.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS WILL BE HELD IN PERPETUITY. ONLY INCOME FROM THE ENDOWMENT WILL BE USED TO FUND GRANTS OR OPERATIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR DESIGNATIONS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION ENSURES THAT GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS MAINTAIN THEIR 501(C) ELIGIBILITY AND CONTINUE TO OPERATE THEIR ORGANIZATIONS IN A MANNER THAT ADVANCES THE OBJECTIVES OF THE DALLAS WOMEN'S FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11(A)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS SUBJECT TO REVIEW BY THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCE COMMITTEE AND FULL BOARD. THE RETURN IS REVIEWED PRIOR TO FILING FOR COMPLETENESS AND ACCURACY OF DISCLOSURES AND FINANCIAL DATA.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12(C)
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE APPLICATION AND INTERPRETATION OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AS IT RELATES TO BOARD MEMBERS AND THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE APPLICATION AND INTERPRETATION OF THIS POLICY AS IT RELATES TO ALL EMPLOYEES. COMMITTEE CHAIRS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE APPLICATION AND INTERPRETATION OF THIS POLICY AS IT RELATES TO VOLUNTEERS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION EVALUATES THE PROPRIETY OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, WHICH IS SET BY INDEPENDENT PERSONS, IN RELATION TO THEIR PERFORMANCE AS WELL AS IN RELATION TO COMPENSATION PAID BY ORGANIZATIONS OF SIMILAR SCOPE AND ACTIVITIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: AVAILABILITY OF DOCUMENTS TO THE PUBLIC
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: UPON REASONABLE REQUEST, EITHER IN WRITING OR IN PERSON, THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES ALL DOCUMENTS REQUIRED TO BE MADE PUBLIC BY AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER IRC 501(C).

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION AMENDED ITS CERTIFICATE OF FORMATION EFFECTIVE JANUARY 2010 AND ITS BYLAWS EFFECTIVE FEBRUARY 2010. SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE RESTATED CERTIFICATE OF FORMATION ARE AS FOLLOWS: * CLARIFIES THE PURPOSES OF THE FOUNDATION TO STATE, "... THE CORPORATION SHALL SUPPORT PROGRAMS THAT ADVANCE SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR WOMEN AND GIRLS." * PROVIDES THAT THE NUMBER OF DIRECTORS SHALL BE DETERMINED FROM TIME TO TIME IN THE MANNER PROVIDED FOR IN THE BYLAWS OF THE FOUNDATION. * INDEMNIFIES COMMITTEE MEMBERS IN SPECIFIED SITUATIONS AND CLARIFIES THE PROVISIONS FOR INDEMNIFICATION, ADVANCEMENT OF EXPENSES, AND MAINTENANCE OF INSURANCE BY THE FOUNDATION. SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN THE AMENDED AND RESTATED BYLAWS ARE AS FOLLOWS: * CHANGES TERM OF SERVICE FOR BOARD MEMBERS FROM 2 TO 3 YEARS, WITH A GENERAL LIMIT OF 2 TERMS. * CHANGES TERM OF SERVICE FOR BOARD OFFICERS FROM 1 TO 2 YEARS. * SPECIFIES THAT THE TERM OF COMMITTEE CHAIRS WILL BE 1 YEAR (UNLESS THE COMMITTEE CHAIR IS AN OFFICER). * CLARIFIES THAT DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS MAY NOT RECEIVE COMPENSATION FOR THEIR SERVICES. * SEPARATES THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF ELECTED OFFICERS FROM COMMITTEE RESPONSIBILITIES AND UPDATES THE STANDING COMMITTEE NAMES. THE REVISED BYLAWS ARE ALSO REVISED TO MORE ACCURATELY REFLECT THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF OFFICERS AND COMMITTEES. * DETAILS THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER STAFF OFFICERS AND THEIR POWERS AND DUTIES. * PROVIDES FOR INDEMNIFICATION. * THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WAS ADDED TO THE BYLAWS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: EMPLOYEES REPORTED THROUGH OUTSOURCED PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION DID NOT ISSUE FORM W2S DIRECTLY. THE INDIVIDUALS THAT COMPRISE THE TOTAL LISTED ON LINE 2(A) ARE CONSIDERED EMPLOYEES OF THE Foundation FOR THE PURPOSES OF PART V. HOWEVER, THE ORGANIZATION UTILIZES A PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYER ORGANIZATION, ZOGG SERVICES, WHICH IS THE EMPLOYER OF RECORD, ISSUES ALL W-2S AND ACTS AS AN OUTSOURCED HUMAN RESOURCES PAYROLL DEPARTMENT FOR THE FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: STOCK GIFTS RECEIVED AS PLEDGE PAYMENTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION RECEIVED MISCELLANEOUS NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS IN THE AMOUNT OF $19,506 AS RECORDED IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1(G). THE FOUNDATION ALSO RECEIVED 6 GIFTS OF PUBLICLY TRADED STOCK TOTALING $486,595 AS DETERMINED BY QUOTED MARKET PRICES. THESE GIFTS ARE NOT REPORTED IN SCHEDULE M SINCE THEY WERE RECEIVED IN FULFILLMENT OF PRIOR YEAR PLEDGES, AND THEREFORE, THERE ARE NO ASSOCIATED REVENUES REPORTED IN FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1(G) FOR THE CURRENT YEAR.
